skill.description: Combine vector and keyword search for improved retrieval. Use when implementing RAG systems, building search engines, or when neither approach alone provides sufficient recall.

skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation with Python templates for hybrid search. The examples call external databases and Elasticsearch, which implies network access in user implementations. No credential access, filesystem access, or command execution is present.

content.user_title: Build hybrid search with vector and keyword fusion
content.value_statement: Pure vector or keyword search can miss important results. This skill shows proven fusion patterns to improve recall in hybrid search systems.
actual_capabilities: Explain hybrid search architecture and fusion methods
Provide Python templates for RRF and linear fusion
Show PostgreSQL pgvector and full text hybrid queries
Show Elasticsearch hybrid query with dense vector and BM25
Outline a hybrid RAG pipeline with optional reranking
limitations: No turnkey deployment or infrastructure scripts
Requires existing vector and keyword stores
Examples are templates that need schema adaptation

use_cases.title: Improve retrieval recall
use_cases.description: Combine semantic and keyword search to reduce misses on exact terms.

use_cases.title: Add hybrid ranking
use_cases.description: Integrate RRF or linear fusion into an existing search stack.

use_cases.title: Prototype hybrid search
use_cases.description: Evaluate PostgreSQL or Elasticsearch hybrid retrieval patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Start with RRF
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain Reciprocal Rank Fusion and provide a small Python function that fuses two ranked lists.

prompt_templates.title: Postgres hybrid query
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a pgvector plus full text hybrid query with RRF scoring and metadata filters.

prompt_templates.title: Elasticsearch hybrid
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a hybrid Elasticsearch query combining dense vector and BM25 with adjustable boosts.

prompt_templates.title: RAG pipeline design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a hybrid RAG pipeline with parallel searches, fusion, and optional cross encoder rerank.

output_examples.input: Create a hybrid search plan for my product catalog
output: Run vector and keyword searches in parallel
Fuse results with RRF and tune weights
Rerank top candidates with a cross encoder
Log scores and evaluate recall on test queries

best_practices: Tune fusion weights on real query logs
Use RRF when you need simple, stable fusion
Rerank only a limited candidate window
anti_patterns: Skipping keyword search for exact terms
Ignoring empty or single term query behavior

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a guidance skill with Python examples that work across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of the templates?
faq.answer: They are reference implementations and need adaptation to your data schema and ranking needs.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my vector store?
faq.answer: Replace the search calls in the pipeline with your store client and return the same fields.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data?
faq.answer: No. The content is static and does not execute or transmit data.

faq.question: What if hybrid search returns empty results?
faq.answer: Check tokenization, filters, and index health, then lower thresholds or expand candidate size.

faq.question: How does this compare to pure vector search?
faq.answer: Hybrid search improves recall for exact terms while keeping semantic relevance.
